steps.title: Draw an upside-down teardrop shape, tilted to the right.
steps.content: Draw an upside-down teardrop shape, tilted to the right. Round out the pointy end so it looks more like a large almond.

steps.title: Sketch the scales overlapping each other.
steps.content: Sketch the scales overlapping each other. Make them like fish scales, vaguely trapezoidal and becoming smaller towards either end, with bigger sections in the middle.

steps.title: Outline the pine cone's shape over the sketch with a neat line.
steps.content: Outline the pine cone's shape over the sketch with a neat line. Detail the scales' shape.

steps.title: Add oval/round shapes on the scales.
steps.content: Add oval/round shapes on the scales. Finish up with a little stem on top of the cone, with short vertical lines to indicate the fractures in the wood.

steps.title: Line the drawing with black ink.
steps.content: Line the drawing with black ink. Try to make a modular line, which passes from a thin to a thick line and vice versa. This will make your drawing look better and more professional.

steps.title: Color the inked drawing.
steps.content: Color the inked drawing. Erase the pencil and add in color. Pine cones on the ground tend to come in shades of brown, but if yours happens to be in a tree it might be green or something else entirely. It's up to you!
